title: Why are there so few black managers at the top of football?
teaser: A new report accuses English football of being institutionally racist. It found only 3.4% of top coaching positions at English clubs are taken up by non-white coaches, despite at least 25% of players coming from black and asian backgrounds. We'll be hearing from former players and coaches. And we're asking is it time for an English version of the "Rooney Rule" which makes clubs in America's NFL consider minority  applicants.
